project.name: postprocessing
project.description: A post processing library that provides the means to implement 2D filter effects for three.js.

materials.name: materials
materials.description:
A compilation of the shader materials that are used 
in the post processing passes.

passes.name: passes
passes.description: A compilation of the post processing passes.

BokehMaterial.name: BokehMaterial
BokehMaterial.description:
Depth-of-field shader with bokeh ported from GLSL shader by Martins Upitis.
http://blenderartists.org/forum/showthread.php?237488-GLSL-depth-of-field-with-bokeh-v2-4-(update)

CombineMaterial.name: CombineMaterial
CombineMaterial.description: A material for combining two textures.

params.name: invertTexture1
params.description: - Invert the first texture's rgb values.

params.name: invertTexture2
params.description: - Invert the second texture's rgb values.

ConvolutionMaterial.name: ConvolutionMaterial
ConvolutionMaterial.description:
A convolution blur shader material.

Use this shader five times in a row while adjusting the kernel 
before each render call in order to get the same result as with 
a 35x35 Gauss filter.

Implementation based on the GDC2003 Presentation by Masaki Kawase, Bunkasha Games:
Frame Buffer Postprocessing Effects in DOUBLE-S.T.E.A.L (Wreckless)

Further modified according to:
 https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/3DDrawing/Conceptual/OpenGLES_ProgrammingGuide/BestPracticesforShaders/BestPracticesforShaders.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008793-CH7-SW15

FilmMaterial.name: FilmMaterial
FilmMaterial.description:
Film grain & scanlines shader

- ported from HLSL to WebGL / GLSL
http://www.truevision3d.com/forums/showcase/staticnoise_colorblackwhite_scanline_shaders-t18698.0.html

Screen Space Static Postprocessor

Produces an analogue noise overlay similar to a film grain / TV static

Original implementation and noise algorithm
Pat "Hawthorne" Shearon

Optimized scanlines + noise version with intensity scaling
Georg "Leviathan" Steinrohder

This version is provided under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

GlitchMaterial.name: GlitchMaterial
GlitchMaterial.description:
A glitch shader material.
Based on https://github.com/staffantan/unityglitch

GodRaysMaterial.name: GodRaysMaterial
GodRaysMaterial.description:
A crepuscular rays shader material.

References:

Thibaut Despoulain, 2012:
 (WebGL) Volumetric Light Approximation in Three.js
 http://bkcore.com/blog/3d/webgl-three-js-volumetric-light-godrays.html

Nvidia, GPU Gems 3 - Chapter 13:
 Volumetric Light Scattering as a Post-Process
 http://http.developer.nvidia.com/GPUGems3/gpugems3_ch13.html

LuminosityMaterial.name: LuminosityMaterial
LuminosityMaterial.description:
A luminance shader material.

This shader produces a greyscale luminance map. 
It can also be configured to output colors that are scaled with their 
respective luminance value. Additionally, a range may be provided to 
mask out undesired texels.

The alpha channel will remain unaffected in all cases.

params.name: color
params.description: - Defines whether the shader should output colors scaled with their luminance value.

params.name: range
params.description: - If provided, the shader will mask out texels that aren't in the specified range.

AdaptiveToneMappingPass.name: AdaptiveToneMappingPass
AdaptiveToneMappingPass.description:
Generates a texture that represents the luminosity of the current scene, adapted over time
to simulate the optic nerve responding to the amount of light it is receiving.
Based on a GDC2007 presentation by Wolfgang Engel titled "Post-Processing Pipeline"

Full-screen tone-mapping shader based on http://www.graphics.cornell.edu/~jaf/publications/sig02_paper.pdf

BloomPass.name: BloomPass
BloomPass.description:
A bloom pass.

This pass renders a scene with superimposed blur 
by utilising the fast Kawase convolution approach.

props.name: resolutionScale
props.description: - The render texture resolution scale, relative to the screen render size.

props.name: distinction
props.description: - The luminance distinction factor. Raise this value to bring out the brighter elements in the scene.

BokehPass.name: BokehPass
BokehPass.description: Depth-of-field pass using a bokeh shader.

params.name: camera
params.description: - The camera to use to render the scene.

params.name: scale
params.description: - The scale of the overall effect.

FilmPass.name: FilmPass
FilmPass.description: A film pass providing scan lines, greyscale and noise effects.

props.name: scanlines
props.description: - The number of scanlines in percent, relative to the screen height.

props.name: dtSize
props.description: - The size of the generated noise map.

props.name: density
props.description: - The density of the light rays.

props.name: clampMax
props.description: - An upper bound for the saturation of the overall effect.

props.name: intensity
props.description: - A constant factor for additive blending.

props.name: blurriness
props.description: - The strength of the preliminary blur phase.

props.name: resolutionScale
props.description: - The render texture resolution scale, relative to the screen render size.

props.name: samples
props.description: - The number of samples per pixel.

params.name: camera
params.description: - The camera to use to render the scene.

Pass.name: Pass
Pass.description:
An abstract pass.

This class implements a dispose method that frees memory on demand.
The EffectComposer calls this method when it is being destroyed.

For this mechanism to work properly, please assign your render targets, 
materials or textures directly to your pass!

You can prevent your disposable objects from being deleted by keeping them 
inside deeper structures such as arrays or objects.

params.name: camera
params.description: - The camera will be added to the given scene if it has no parent.

params.name: quad
params.description: - A quad that fills the screen. Used for rendering a pure 2D effect. Set this to null, if you don't need it.

RenderPass.name: RenderPass
RenderPass.description:
A pass that renders a given scene directly on screen
or into the read buffer for further processing.

params.name: camera
params.description: - The camera to use to render the scene.

params.name: overrideMaterial
params.description: - An override material for the scene.

SavePass.name: SavePass
SavePass.description:
A save pass that renders the result from a previous 
pass (readBuffer) to an arbitrary render target.

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: - The render target to use for saving the read buffer.

params.name: resize
params.description: - Whether the render target should adjust to the size of the read/write buffer.

ShaderPass.name: ShaderPass
ShaderPass.description:
A shader pass.

Used to render any shader material as a 2D filter.

EffectComposer.name: EffectComposer
EffectComposer.description:
The EffectComposer may be used in place of a normal WebGLRenderer.

It will disable the auto clear behaviour of the provided renderer to prevent 
unnecessary clear operations.

You may want to use a RenderPass as your first pass to automatically clear 
the screen and render the scene to a texture for further processing.

params.name: renderer
params.description: - A renderer that should be used for rendering the passes.

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: - A pre-configured render target to use as a read/write buffer.

classitems.description:
The Kawase blur kernels for five consecutive convolution passes.
The result matches the 35x35 Gauss filter.
classitems.name: kernels

classitems.description:
Adjusts the kernel for the next blur pass.
Call this method before each render iteration.
classitems.name: adjustKernel

classitems.description: Sets whether this pass uses adaptive luminosity.
classitems.name: setAdaptive

classitems.description: Sets the adaption rate (tau) for the adaptive luminosity.
classitems.name: setAdaptionRate

classitems.description: Sets the maximum luminosity value for the adaptive luminosity.
classitems.name: setMaxLuminance

classitems.description: Sets the average luminance value for tone-mapping.
classitems.name: setAverageLuminance

classitems.description: Sets the middle grey value for tone-mapping.
classitems.name: setMiddleGrey

classitems.description: Deletes all render targets and materials.
classitems.name: dispose

classitems.description:
The resolution scale.

You need to call the reset method of the EffectComposer after 
changing this value.
classitems.name: renderTargetY

classitems.description: The strength of the preliminary blur phase.
classitems.name: blurriness

classitems.description:
Renders the effect.

Applies a luminance filter and convolution blur to the read buffer and 
renders the result into a seperate render target. The result is additively 
blended with the read buffer.
classitems.name: render

classitems.description: Adjusts the format and size of the render targets.
classitems.name: initialise

params.name: alpha
params.description: - Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description: This pass disables the stencil test.
classitems.name: render

classitems.description: Adjusts the size of the effect.
classitems.name: initialise

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description:
The amount of scanlines in percent, relative to the screen height.

You need to call the reset method of the EffectComposer after 
changing this value.
classitems.name: scanlines

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description:
A perturbation map.

If none is provided, a noise texture will be created.
The texture will automatically be destroyed when the 
EffectComposer is deleted.
classitems.name: perturbMap

classitems.description:
The effect mode.

Check the Mode enumeration for available modes.
classitems.name: mode

classitems.description: A random break point for the sporadic glitch activation.
classitems.name: breakPoint

classitems.description: Creates a random break point for the glitch effect.
classitems.name: generateTrigger

classitems.description:
Destroys the currently set texture, if any, and 
generates a simple noise map.
classitems.name: generatePerturbMap

classitems.description:
A glitch mode enumeration.

SPORADIC is the default mode (randomly timed glitches).
classitems.name: GlitchPass.Mode

classitems.description: A render target for rendering the masked scene.
classitems.name: renderTargetMask

classitems.description:
The resolution scale.

You need to call the setSize method of the EffectComposer 
after changing this value.
classitems.name: renderTargetY

classitems.description: The light position in screen space.
classitems.name: screenPosition

classitems.description: A combine shader material used for rendering to screen.
classitems.name: combineMaterial

classitems.description: A copy shader material used for rendering to texture.
classitems.name: copyMaterial

classitems.description: A material used for masking the scene objects.
classitems.name: maskMaterial

classitems.description: The strength of the preliminary blur phase.
classitems.name: blurriness

classitems.description: The overall intensity of the effect.
classitems.name: intensity

classitems.description:
The number of samples per pixel.

This value must be carefully chosen. A higher value increases the 
GPU load directly and doesn't necessarily yield better results!
classitems.name: samples

classitems.description:
Used for saving the original clear color 
during the rendering process of the masked scene.
classitems.name: CLEAR_COLOR

classitems.description:
Renders the scene.

The read buffer is assumed to contain the normally rendered scene.
The god rays pass has four phases with a total of 8 render steps.

Mask Phase:
 The scene is rendered using a mask material.

Prelminiary Blur Phase:
 The masked scene is blurred five consecutive times.

God Rays Phase:
 The blurred scene is blurred again, but this time along radial lines towards the light source.

Composite Phase:
 The final result is added to the normal scene.
classitems.name: render

classitems.description: Adjusts the format and size of the render targets.
classitems.name: initialise

params.name: alpha
params.description: - Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description:
Renders the scene as a mask by only setting the stencil bits.
The buffers will both be cleared first.
classitems.name: render

params.name: readBuffer
params.description: - The read buffer containing the result of the previous pass.

classitems.description:
The quad mesh to use for rendering.

Assign your shader material to this mesh!
classitems.name: quad

classitems.description:
Indicates whether the read and write buffers should be swapped after this 
pass has finished rendering.

Set this to true if this pass renders to the write buffer so that a 
following pass can find the result in the read buffer.
classitems.name: needsSwap

classitems.description:
Renders the effect.

This is an abstract method that must be overridden.
classitems.name: render

throws.description: An error is thrown if the method is not overridden.

params.name: readBuffer
params.description: - A read buffer. Contains the result of the previous pass.

params.name: writeBuffer
params.description: - A write buffer. Normally used as the render target.

params.name: maskActive
params.description: - Indicates whether a stencil test mask is active or not.

classitems.description:
Performs advanced initialisation tasks.

By implementing this abstract method you gain access to the renderer.
You'll also be able to configure your custom render targets to use the 
appropriate format (RGB or RGBA).

The provided renderer can be used to warm up special off-screen render 
targets by performing a preliminary render operation.
classitems.name: initialise

params.name: alpha
params.description: - Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

classitems.description:
Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

This is an abstract method that may be overriden in case you want to be 
informed about the main render size.

The effect composer calls this method when its own size is updated.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description:
Performs a shallow search for properties that define a dispose method and 
deletes them. The pass will be inoperative after this method was called!

Disposable objects:
 - render targets
 - materials
 - textures

The EffectComposer calls this method automatically when it is being
destroyed. You may, however, use it independently to free memory 
when you are certain that you don't need this pass anymore.
classitems.name: dispose

classitems.description: Used for saving the original clear color during rendering.
classitems.name: CLEAR_COLOR

classitems.description:
Indicates whether the render target should be resized when
the size of the composer's read/write buffer changes.
classitems.name: resize

classitems.description: Updates this pass with the renderer's size.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description:
The name of the color sampler uniform of the given material.
The read buffer will be bound to this.
classitems.name: textureID

classitems.description: The shader material to use for rendering.
classitems.name: material

classitems.description:
The read buffer.

Reading from and writing to the same render target should be avoided. 
Therefore, two seperate, yet identical buffers are used.
classitems.name: readBuffer

classitems.description: A copy pass used to copy masked scenes.
classitems.name: copyPass

classitems.description: Creates a new render target by replicating the renderer's canvas.
classitems.name: createBuffer

return.description: A fresh render target that equals the renderer's canvas.

classitems.description: Adds a pass, optionally at a specific index.
classitems.name: addPass

params.name: index
params.description: - An index at which the pass should be inserted.

classitems.description: Renders all enabled passes in the order in which they were added.
classitems.name: render

params.name: delta
params.description: - The time between the last frame and the current one.

classitems.description:
Sets the size of the render targets and the output canvas.

Every pass will be informed of the new size. It's up to each pass how that 
information is used.

If no width or height is specified, the render targets and passes will be 
updated with the current size.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description: Resets this composer by deleting all passes and creating new buffers.
classitems.name: reset

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: - A new render target to use. If none is provided, the settings of the old buffers will be used.

classitems.description:
Destroys all passes and render targets.

This method deallocates all render targets, textures and materials created 
by the passes. It also deletes this composer's frame buffers.

Note: the reset method uses the dispose method internally.
classitems.name: dispose

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: - A new render target. If none is provided, the composer will become inoperative.
